title: Volibear's new rendition is amazing but...
body:
Are we gonna just ignore how badass Udyr was standing besides the Bear Spirit? Channeling every animal spirit, even the Bear, the one that allowed Volibear to corrupt so many other Spirit Walkers, and finishing up with the Ram, Udyr just made clear that if Volibear ever tried to lay a hand on his daughter, he will fight to the bitter end against him, even through he knows that he is no match for such monster.

He looked in the (many) eyes of the demon itself and threatened it, overcoming his weakness to protect another. 

I can't wait to see his rework (and Volibear's) after reading this.

To me this is why Udyr is heroic.  He turned away from the only mental peace he’s had, and looked a horrific monster in the eyes and said...

“f u.   I dont know how, but i refuse to lose, no matter what, so you will not take my daughter and i will find a way.”
My daughter, as in sworn father? or biological father? i'm pretty sure i know the answer. just asking to make sure.
In the freljord they don’t seperate step fathers from fathers.

Hey Odin can I ask since you also wrote Sejuani's bio, your process for writing Kalkia since from what we've seen from today's Warmother issue and Sej's bio, she seems like a very selfish and incompetent leader

Kalkia is someone who put her own desires before her responsibility to her people, returned to them at their lowest point out of a sense of obligation, and who ultimately chose the stability that came with subservience to the Frostguard and Frost Priests over striving to reinvigorate the Winter's Claw herself. She might be a capable warrior but she's absolutely someone prone to making selfish decisions and who never had grand ambitions for the post of Warmother. She's a leader who would rather accept safety in mediocrity and defer responsibility than be like Sejuani and "try the impossible" in the hope of achieving something greater.
This what i see. I’d love to ask WAAARGHbobo why the the stubbornness/strength of the Serylda line skipped a generation
Sorry, no spoilers.   The answer to these questions is something your gonna have to wait for.

i understand that but i'm not wondering about the differences or if they separate it or not. In Sejuani bio we see that she was a children of political marriage and her mother left to pursue another man. most people suspect that man was Udry but i'm skeptical about it.

I also loved how much character growth this story added by giving Udyr a motive to grow beyond his limitations.

Not long ago he was a feral man, posessed by the spirits of the wild around him, and even through he couldn't alone, he soon got a friend that helped him. Even in this story we see a constant "I can't", Udyr couldn't control the influx of voices all around him, the maddening cacophony, as much as he couldn't convince Sejuani not to summon the Lost Ones nor could he resist the powerfull influence of The Volibear. Its when Sejuani is close that Udyr surpass his limits and goes from "I can't" to "but I must", not for himself, but for his daughter's sake.

For me, the most exciting moments were both times that he confronted Volibear, as Udyr went even beyond and transformed the "but I must" into "I will", with a clear mind and a will of steel even when facing death itself in the form of a bear

This story was incredibly well written and at least in my opinion, its one of the best Lore pieces I've ever read, congratulations to the Lore Team for such success
